summary: Surell Brady was a Staff Counsel for the House Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). Payroll records and certification reports from 1977 and 1978 list Brady's name, position, and salary as an employee of the HSCA. One document is a Final Determination Notification from the Assassination Records Review Board regarding the status of HSCA staff payroll records, which includes payroll authorization forms for Surell Brady. The documents indicate that Brady was employed by the HSCA during its investigation into the JFK assassination.
significance: Surell Brady's significance lies in their role as a Staff Counsel for the HSCA, an organization tasked with investigating the assassination of JFK. Their presence in payroll and certification documents confirms their employment and contribution to the committee's work.
